intro: Psychotria mafuluensis, commonly known as the Mafulu Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in the Democratic Republic of the Congo and the Central African Republic. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often growing in the understorey of dense tropical forests. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
